title: Coastal Tragedy: Search and Rescue Efforts in Harsh Conditions
summary: A major search and rescue operation occurred off the east Yorkshire coast in Withernsea on Friday, resulting in two fatalities and one person still missing. Humberside Police reported that emergency services responded to reports of multiple individuals in difficulty in the water. One unconscious 67-year-old man was rescued but died at the scene, and a second body was recovered later. The incident, reported at 15:10 GMT, involved extensive resources including a rescue helicopter, air ambulance, and RNLI crews from nearby towns. Search efforts were challenged by severe weather conditions, with snow, ice, and rough seas complicating operations. The search paused overnight and resumed at first light on Saturday. In response, Withernsea Methodist Church opened for prayers and emotional support, highlighting community solidarity. Police have stated the circumstances are not suspicious, focusing on the tragic nature of the event amid ongoing investigations.
